text.0: i call with prayers on aditi your goddess on agni mitra varuṇa for favour.
text.1: on aryaman who gives unasked the gracious on gods who save on savitar and bhaga.
text.2: visit to prove us free from sin o sūrya lord of great might the bright gods sprung from dakṣa.
text.3: twiceborn and true observing sacred duties holy and full of light whose tongue is agni.
text.4: and o ye heaven and earth a wide dominion o ye most blissful worlds our lofty shelter.
text.5: give ample room and freedom for our dwelling a home ye hemispheres which none may rival.
text.6: this day invited may the sons of rudra resistless excellent stoop down to meet us.
text.7: for when beset with slight or sore affliction we ever call upon the gods the maruts.
text.8: to whom the goddess rodasī clings closely whom pūṣan follows bringing ample bounty.
text.9: what time ye hear our call and come o maruts upon your separate path all creatures tremble.
text.10: with a new hymn extol o thou who singest the lover of the song the hero indra.
text.11: may he exalted hear our invocation and grant us mighty wealth and strength when lauded.
text.12: give full protection friends of man ye waters in peace and trouble to our sons and grandsons.
text.13: for ye are our most motherly physicians parents of all that standeth all that moveth.
text.14: may savitar come hither and approach us the god who rescues holy goldenhanded.
text.15: the god who bounteous as the face of morning discloses precious gifts for him who worships.
text.16: and thou o son of strength do thou turn hither the gods today to this our holy service.
text.17: may i for evermore enjoy thy bounty and agni by thy grace be rich in heroes.
text.18: come also to my call o ye nāsatyas yea verily through my prayers ye holy sages.
text.19: as from great darkness ye delivered atri protect us chiefs from danger in the conflict.
text.20: o gods bestow upon us riches splendid with strength and heroes bringing food in plenty.
text.21: be gracious helpful gods of earth of heaven born of the cow and dwellers in the waters.
text.22: may rudra and sarasvatī accordant viṣṇu and vāyu pour down gifts and bless us.
text.23: Ṛbhukṣan vāja and divine vidhatar parjanya vāta make our food abundant.
text.24: may this god savitar the lord the offspring of waters pouring down his dew be gracious.
text.25: and with the gods and dames accordant tvaṣṭar dyaus with the gods and prthivi with oceans.
text.26: may ajaekapād and ahibudhnya and earth and ocean hear our invocation.
text.27: all gods who strengthen law invoked and lauded and holy texts uttered by sages help us.
text.28: so with my thoughts and hymns of praise the children of bharadvāja sing aloud to please you.
text.29: the dames invoked and the resistless vasus and all ye holy ones have been exalted.
